results.title: Davy Jones' locker
results.brief_description: From the animated series “Willie Whopper’s Adventures”, the story of Willie Whopper, a little boy with a big imagination. Willie tangles with denizens of the deep, including a vast and menacing Poseidon figure and a drunken pirate (Davy Jones), who swills hooch while slamming his peg-leg stump on the deck of his room. Lots of sea-creature sight gags, too.

results.title: Davy Crockett: king of the wild frontier
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Norman Foster
results.brief_description: Davy Crockett was a legendary folk hero. Starring Fess Parker as Crockett, the hero fights alligators, battles an Indian Chief in a savage tomahawk duel and fights for freedom at the ill-fated Alamo. Accompanied by his friend George Russell, played by Buddy Ebsen, “Davy Crockett” is a daring adventure of drama, humour and excitement and will remain a colourful portrayal of the frontier.

results.title: Davis Cup, 1956
results.creator_credit: Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Peter Whitchurch
results.brief_description: Edited action footage of all the matches in the 1956 David Cup Final between Australia and USA. Australia won all matches to make it its 13th Davis Cup victory and was represented by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall and USA by Victor Seixas, Herbert Flam and Sam Giammalva. Contains footage of historical interest including Robert Menzies in various spectator shots, Harry Hopman receiving Davis cup from Richard Nixon, then Vice President, for 1955 victory.

results.title: Davidsbundlertanze
results.brief_description: Schumann’s cycle of 28 short pieces for the piano written in 1837, has been choreographed by George Balanchine in 1980. The pieces concerns the composers own life, his love for his wife, his war on the critics of the day, and the conflict of the personalities within his own mind. This brilliant production of this moving piece is performed by the principal members of the New York City Ballet.

results.title: David Oistrakh: remembering a musician
results.brief_description: Filmed in the Soviet Union in 1982, this is a biographical documentary on the life of the great Russian violinist David Oistrakh. Odessa, the place of Oistrakh’s birth in 1908, was also to be the city of his official debut in 1926. However it was not until 1933 before he appeared in Moscow and the following year that he was appointed a professor at the Moscow Conservatory. Travelling the world, performing concert after concert David Oistrakh, at the age of 66, died in 1974 in Amsterdam. The film uses stills, archival footage, excerpts from various performances, interviews and includes images of Odessa and Leningrad. In Russian and English with English narration by Erick Friedman.

results.title: David Malouf: an imaginary life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Poet and novelist David Malouf was filmed in Tuscany, Italy, during the coldest winter there for 50 years, and in Sydney during a steamy summer. To write, he says, you must turn your back on even the most beautiful landscape. Malouf talks about the influences on his work and how he gets into the writing process.

results.title: David Livingston
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank, Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and David Middlemas
results.brief_description: Outlines the early days of David Livingston(e) in Africa and the series of journeys throughout the continent extending over a period of 30 years. The film illustrates particularly the importance of Livington’s exploration and actual scenes show the nature of the country through which he made his journeys. Tribute is paid to his work in combating the slave trade. The film ends with a reconstruction of this meeting with Stanley and an artist’s impression of his death and the final journey of his body to the coast and to Westminster Abbey.

results.title: David Lean: a self portrait
results.creator_credit: Thomas Craven Film Corporation and Thomas Craven
results.brief_description: A comprehensive documentary made in collaboration with the noted director at work on the set, on location, and in the editing room, as he explains his viewpoint about the film and his method of work. Illustrates with excerpt from several of Lean’s films, which together have won a number of awards. Includes interviews with Sam Spiegel who produced some of Lean’s early films and Robert Bolt who wrote the scripts for Lean’s last three films.

results.title: David Kennedy [ALP Member for Bendigo]
results.brief_description: Campaign film for ALP Member for Bendigo, David Kennedy. Features footage of Kennedy campaigning in the streets of Bendigo with Gough Whitlam and being interviewed about his views on Bendigo and his family. Issues of concern to the community are raised such as postal services, state of the education system, and loss of youth to the bigger cities. Also desire for a National Health Scheme and concern for wheat farmers. Features good shots of historical interest of Bendigo in the early 1970s. Script by Bill Hartley.

results.title: David Copperfield
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, David O. Selznick and George Cukor
results.brief_description: David Copperfield enjoys an idyllic life with his gentle mother and his loving nurse, Peggotty. Tragedy strikes when Mr Murdstone, a monster of cruelty, weds David’s mother and drives her to an early grave. His adventures from this time introduce us to every stratum of colourful Victorian society. Since its debut in 1935, “David Copperfield” has been acclaimed for its handpicked cast, one that remains unsurpassed to this day. Stars W.C. Fields, Maureen O’Sullivan, Lionel Barrymore, Freddie Bartholomew, May Oliver, Basil Rathbone and over 65 star cast players. Based on the novel by Charles Dickens. Rated: G
